Problem:
Consider a function \\( u(x, t) \\) governed by the partial differential equation \\( \\frac{\\partial u}{\\partial t} =  L u \\) where L is a linear differential operator. We inspect the effect of an integral transformation defined by \\( F(u) = \\int_0^\\infty e^{-st} u(x, t) \\, dt \\), which is the Laplace transform of \\( u \\) with respect to time.

If \\( F(u) \\) is applied and then \\( u(x, t) \\) continues to evolve under its differential equation without further interventions, will the function \\( u(x, t) \\) at any later time t be identical to if \\( F(u) \\) had not been applied?
Explanation: The application of \\( F(u) \\), being merely a transformation for observation, does not alter the physical state or the evolution under the differential equation itself. The transformation is independent of the temporal development of \\( u \\).
